hotels.name: SIGNIEL Seoul
hotels.desc: Luxury High-Rise Hotel; Lotte World Tower; Iconic skyline views
hotels.longDesc: Perched in Lotte World Tower, this ultra-luxury hotel delivers iconic Seoul skyline views and world-class service from every angle, making it unforgettable for special occasions.

hotels.name: Four Seasons Hotel Seoul
hotels.desc: Luxury Hotel; Central base for palaces/museums; First-timers
hotels.longDesc: A perfectly central base for palace hopping and museum visits, this classic luxury hotel puts all of Seoul's cultural treasures within easy reach for families.

hotels.name: The Shilla Seoul
hotels.desc: Luxury Hotel; Resort-like grounds; Classic luxury
hotels.longDesc: Set on lush, resort-like grounds with a serene feel, this iconic hotel offers a calming escape from the city buzz while staying perfectly central for exploring.

hotels.name: Josun Palace, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Seoul
hotels.desc: Luxury Hotel; Art Deco flair; Design-forward luxury
hotels.longDesc: Art Deco elegance meets modern luxury in this design-forward hotel, beloved by travelers who appreciate thoughtful architecture and refined interiors.

hotels.name: Le Méridien Seoul Myeongdong
hotels.desc: Upscale Hotel; Convenient newish base; Shopping + sightseeing
hotels.longDesc: A newer, upscale option right in the heart of the shopping and sightseeing action, offering convenience and excellent service without the ultra-premium price.

hotels.name: Hotel 28 Myeongdong
hotels.desc: Boutique Hotel; Compact, polished rooms; Central base
hotels.longDesc: Perfectly positioned for shopping and culture, this stylish boutique hotel offers polished, compact rooms and an unbeatable central location.

hotels.name: Mondrian Seoul Itaewon

hotels.longDesc: A lifestyle hotel with a rooftop pool and bar scene that draws sophisticated travelers and families looking for modern design and vibrant energy.

hotels.name: RYSE

hotels.name: voco Seoul Gangnam
hotels.desc: Upscale Hotel; Comfortable rooms; Value-leaning upscale

hotels.name: L7 Myeongdong
hotels.desc: Upscale Hotel; Great transit access; Convenience + views
hotels.longDesc: With excellent transit access and elevated views, this upscale spot delivers both convenience and a sense of arrival without breaking the bank.

hotels.name: SIGNIEL Busan

hotels.name: Grand Josun Busan

restaurants.name: Mingles
restaurants.desc: Contemporary Korean; MICHELIN 3-star (reservation essential)
restaurants.longDesc: Korea's highest-rated restaurant, Mingles delivers refined contemporary Korean cuisine that respects tradition while pushing boundaries—reserve well in advance.

restaurants.name: Soigné
restaurants.desc: Modern Cuisine; MICHELIN 2-star
restaurants.longDesc: A intimate 2-star jewel serving modern cuisine with meticulous technique, beloved by food-focused travelers seeking an understated yet exceptional experience.

restaurants.name: Evett

restaurants.longDesc: A two-star chef's kitchen where creativity and technique shine through unexpected flavor combinations and precise plating.

restaurants.name: Jungsik

restaurants.longDesc: This 2-star modern Korean restaurant balances innovation with Korean roots, serving dishes that feel both exciting and rooted in culinary tradition.

restaurants.name: Kwonsooksoo

restaurants.longDesc: Refined Korean cuisine honored through masterful technique and seasonal ingredients, offering tradition elevated to an art form.

experiences.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace + Changing of the Guard
experiences.longDesc: Seoul's grandest palace comes alive during the colorful changing-of-the-guard ceremony, offering a magical glimpse into royal history—arrive early to secure a front-row spot.

experiences.name: Changdeokgung Palace & Secret Garden
experiences.longDesc: A UNESCO palace complex with a serene, hidden garden perfect for families wanting to explore royal grounds away from the heaviest crowds.

experiences.name: Changgyeonggung Palace
experiences.longDesc: A quieter alternative palace offering authentic palace architecture and history without the tourist masses, ideal for families preferring a peaceful experience.

experiences.name: Bukchon Hanok Village
experiences.longDesc: Traditional hanok houses line picturesque lanes in Seoul's oldest neighborhood, creating photogenic scenes and immersive cultural atmosphere.

experiences.name: Insadong (Tea houses + crafts)
experiences.longDesc: A charming cultural district packed with traditional tea houses, craft galleries, and artisan shops selling authentic Korean souvenirs and snacks.

experiences.name: Jogyesa Temple
experiences.longDesc: A vibrant Buddhist temple famous for its magnificent colorful lanterns and active spiritual community, welcoming visitors warmly.

experiences.name: Jongmyo Shrine
experiences.longDesc: A deep-dive into Joseon dynasty history and ancestor veneration, offering insight into Korea's ancient royal traditions.

experiences.name: Han River Picnic at Banpo Bridge
experiences.longDesc: A quintessential Seoul experience combining riverside picnics with people-watching and the stunning nighttime fountain show.

experiences.name: Seoul Forest
experiences.longDesc: A expansive park with deer enclosures, wide paths perfect for strollers, playgrounds, and peaceful forests—ideal for family outdoor time.

experiences.name: Cheongdam Luxury Street
experiences.longDesc: Seoul's premier high-design shopping district featuring flagship boutiques and architectural landmarks, perfect for design-focused families.

experiences.name: Garosu-gil (Sinsa)
experiences.longDesc: A tree-lined shopping street combining fashion boutiques, art galleries, and charming cafés in an effortlessly cool atmosphere.

experiences.name: Seongsu (Concept stores + cafés)
experiences.desc: Neighborhood; Industrial-chic cafés, pop-ups, and people-watching
experiences.longDesc: An industrial-chic neighborhood of concept stores, pop-up galleries, and design-forward cafés where creative energy pulses through every block.

experiences.name: Myeongdong Shopping Street
experiences.longDesc: Seoul's iconic shopping destination featuring flagship stores, street food vendors, and electric energy that draws families and tourists.

experiences.name: Shinsegae Department Store LED Billboard
experiences.longDesc: An architectural marvel turned photo-op, Seoul's most Instagrammable billboard lighting up the streetscape with immense visual impact.

experiences.name: Olive Young (K-beauty haul)
experiences.desc: Shopping; Flagship is huge—use neighborhood branches if crowded
experiences.longDesc: A sprawling K-beauty supermarket where families can explore Korea's booming skincare and cosmetic innovations at competitive prices.

experiences.name: Gwangjang Market Street Food Crawl
experiences.desc: Food; Taste classic snacks + market energy
experiences.longDesc: A lively traditional market bursting with street food vendors serving everything from bindaetteok to mayak gimbap in an authentic market atmosphere.

experiences.name: Cafe Onion Seongsu
experiences.longDesc: A beloved café with signature pastries and excellent coffee, set in the artsy Seongsu neighborhood perfect for a leisurely break.

experiences.name: Daelim Warehouse (Seongsu)
experiences.longDesc: A warehouse-converted café icon with soaring ceilings and industrial charm, serving excellent coffee and brunch.

experiences.name: Center Coffee (Seongsu)
experiences.longDesc: A specialty coffee roastery and café in the creative Seongsu district, perfect for coffee-loving families.

experiences.name: Seoul Coffee Shops (design route)
experiences.desc: Coffee Culture; Curated list of standout cafés
experiences.longDesc: A curated exploration of Seoul's standout cafés, each offering distinct design aesthetics and excellent coffee.

experiences.name: Hongdae Street Performances
experiences.longDesc: A vibrant neighborhood filled with buskers, street performers, and youthful creative energy—perfect for families seeking lively atmosphere.

experiences.name: Baseball Game (KBO)
experiences.longDesc: A family-friendly Korean baseball game combines lively crowd energy, stadium food, and exciting sports action.

experiences.name: Frieze Seoul / Art Fair Season
experiences.desc: Arts; Big contemporary art moment each year (timing matters)
experiences.longDesc: Seoul's annual contemporary art fair draws galleries from around the world, creating an exciting moment for art-loving families.

experiences.name: Sulwhasoo Spa (luxury skincare spa)
experiences.longDesc: A high-end Korean skincare spa using the Sulwhasoo brand, offering traditional Korean beauty treatments in a luxurious setting.

experiences.name: SPA 1899 (ginseng spa)
experiences.longDesc: A ginseng-focused wellness spa experience showcasing Korea's traditional herbal traditions in a relaxing, therapeutic environment.

experiences.name: Haeundae Beach
experiences.desc: Beach; Classic urban beach; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Busan's classic urban beach offering sandy shores, beachside promenades, and countless seaside cafés and restaurants.

experiences.name: Dalmaji-gil (Haeundae hillside road)
experiences.desc: Scenic Drive/Walk; Cafés + galleries with sea views
experiences.longDesc: A scenic coastal drive lined with cafés and galleries offering sea views and creative small shops.

experiences.name: Marine City Night Skyline
experiences.longDesc: A spectacular nighttime view of Busan's modern skyscrapers illuminated against the dark sea, creating a mesmerizing urban waterfront scene.

experiences.name: UN Memorial Cemetery in Korea
experiences.longDesc: The world's only UN-designated cemetery, honoring international soldiers and offering profound historical context.

experiences.name: Naengmyeon Trio: Damiok / 100.1 / Buda Myeonoak
experiences.desc: Food; Taste Busan’s cold-noodle scene across top picks
experiences.longDesc: A culinary tour across Busan's best cold noodle specialists, each bringing its own technique and flavor personality.

experiences.name: Haeundae Hotel Lounge for Views
experiences.desc: Nightlife; Ocean-view cocktails at hotel lounges
experiences.longDesc: Hotel lounges along Haeundae offer ocean-view cocktails and refined ambiance for a sophisticated evening.

experiences.name: Jeju: Dongmun Traditional Market
experiences.desc: Market; Great near-airport market for snacks + gifts
experiences.longDesc: A lively market near the airport perfect for grabbing final snacks and authentic gifts before departure.

experiences.name: Jeju: Hallasan Hiking Day
experiences.desc: Hiking; Korea’s highest peak; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: A challenging hike to Korea's highest peak through diverse volcanic landscapes, rewarding families with panoramic island views.

experiences.name: Jeju: Volcanic Landscapes + Lava Tubes
experiences.desc: Nature; Explore volcanic geology and lava tube systems
experiences.longDesc: Explore Jeju's unique volcanic geology through lava tubes and rocky formations, understanding the island's dramatic geological story.

experiences.name: Jeju: Quiet Cabin Retreat (Egattoc / forest cabins)
experiences.desc: Design & Nature; Minimalist cabins immersed in forest
experiences.longDesc: Minimalist forest cabins offering peaceful retreat immersed in nature, perfect for families seeking quiet restorative time.

experiences.name: Jeju: Signature Pork Noodle Soup (gogi-guksu)
experiences.desc: Food; Try Jeju’s signature noodle soup at a local favorite
experiences.longDesc: Jeju's iconic dish—tender pork noodles in savory broth—captures island flavors in humble, soul-satisfying bowls.

experiences.name: Jeju Waterfalls Day (Seogwipo)
experiences.longDesc: Easy, scenic walks to beautiful waterfalls surrounded by lush forest, perfect for families seeking manageable nature time.

experiences.name: Jeju: Slow Coastal Drive + Viewpoints
experiences.desc: Scenic Drive; Build a flexible loop around the island’s coasts
experiences.longDesc: A flexible loop around Jeju's coasts with scenic pull-offs, offering flexibility and stunning sea views at every turn.

experiences.name: Seochon Neighborhood Stroll
experiences.desc: Hanok village, traditional home architecture, cafes and galleries
experiences.longDesc: A charming traditional Korean neighborhood filled with restored hanok houses, independent galleries, bookshops, and cozy tea rooms.

experiences.name: Bongeunsa Temple
experiences.desc: Buddhist temple in COEX Gangnam, peaceful urban sanctuary
experiences.longDesc: A serene temple oasis within modern Gangnam's shopping district, offering meditation classes and temple stay experiences.

experiences.name: National Museum of Korea
experiences.desc: World-class museum, Korean art and artifacts, comprehensive
experiences.longDesc: Seoul's flagship museum showcasing Korean heritage from ancient kingdoms through contemporary art, beautifully curated across multiple levels.

experiences.name: Leeum Samsung Museum of Art
experiences.desc: Contemporary art museum, three buildings, cutting-edge design
experiences.longDesc: An architectural marvel housing Korean and international contemporary art, designed by world-renowned architects in an inspiring complex.

experiences.name: War Memorial of Korea
experiences.desc: Korean history museum, armor collections, free admission
experiences.longDesc: A moving museum documenting Korea's military history with impressive artifact collections and educational exhibits for all ages.

experiences.name: Dongdaemun Design Plaza (DDP)
experiences.longDesc: Zaha Hadid landmark; night photos are great Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Seoullo 7017 Skygarden
experiences.longDesc: Elevated walkway; quick scenic stroll Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Cheonggyecheon Stream Night Walk
experiences.longDesc: Easy evening stroll; great with stroller Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Donuimun Museum Village
experiences.longDesc: Interactive “time travel” through modern Korean life Perfect for Families

experiences.name: N Seoul Tower (Namsan Tower)
experiences.longDesc: Classic skyline viewpoint; walk up for a nature break Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Namsan Park Trails
experiences.desc: Easy city hike;, All ages; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Easy city hike; playgrounds + viewpoints Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Ddareungi Bike Ride (Han River)
experiences.longDesc: Rent city bikes and cruise riverside paths Perfect for Kids 6+ / adults

experiences.name: Bukhansan National Park Hike
experiences.longDesc: Trails from easy to strenuous; temples + views Perfect for Active travelers

experiences.name: Olympic Park
experiences.desc: Wide paths for, All ages; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Wide paths for strollers; outdoor sculptures Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Hannam-dong + Itaewon Browsing
experiences.desc: Eclectic shops +, All ages; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Eclectic shops + galleries; easy to combine with Leeum Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: COEX Starfield Library
experiences.desc: Iconic indoor photo, All ages; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Iconic indoor photo spot; great in bad weather Perfect for All ages

experiences.name: Makgeolli Tasting Night
experiences.desc: Try modern makgeolli, Adults; must-see attraction
experiences.longDesc: Try modern makgeolli bars for a local twist Perfect for Adults

kidFriendly.name: Seoul Forest
kidFriendly.desc: 0-12; Big open spaces, paths for strollers, playground areas
kidFriendly.longDesc: Massive open spaces with stroller-friendly paths, playground areas, and deer enclosures create the ideal outdoor playground for young families.

kidFriendly.name: Han River Picnic (Banpo)
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Easy family evening: picnic + river views
kidFriendly.longDesc: An easy, delightful family evening combining riverside picnics, wide-open spaces, and views—perfect for younger kids.

kidFriendly.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace (short loop)
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Keep it short for toddlers
kidFriendly.longDesc: Keep palace visits short and focused for toddlers by exploring just the main grounds rather than attempting extensive touring.

kidFriendly.name: Bukchon Hanok Village (early AM)
kidFriendly.desc: 4-18; Photo-friendly lanes; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: Arriving early avoids crowds and makes for easier stroller navigation and uncluttered photo opportunities.

kidFriendly.name: Gwangjang Market Snack Crawl
kidFriendly.desc: 2-18; Pick mild options; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: Kids love the market energy and snack options—steer toward milder, kid-friendly choices like tteokbokki and fish cakes.

kidFriendly.name: Cafe Onion Seongsu
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Big space; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: A large, spacious café that accommodates families comfortably with good coffee and pastries for parents.

kidFriendly.name: Baseball Game (KBO)
kidFriendly.desc: All ages; Family-friendly, lively atmosphere
kidFriendly.longDesc: A lively, family-oriented Korean baseball atmosphere with accessible seating and plenty of stadium food options.

kidFriendly.name: Haeundae Beach
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Sand play + easy promenade
kidFriendly.longDesc: Classic beach play with sand, water, and easy promenade walks—a timeless kid-approved experience.

kidFriendly.name: Dongmun Traditional Market
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Snack stalls + fruit; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: Market snack stalls and fresh fruit stands keep kids entertained while offering authentic food experiences.

kidFriendly.name: Resort Pool Day (Jungmun)
kidFriendly.desc: 0-12; Low-effort reset day; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: A low-effort reset day at a resort pool offering swimming, relaxation, and built-in entertainment.

kidFriendly.name: Jeju Waterfalls (short walks)
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18; Easy scenic walks; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: Easy, scenic waterfall walks offer manageable nature time and photo opportunities without demanding stamina.

kidFriendly.name: Jeju Volcanic Landscapes
kidFriendly.desc: All ages; Lava tubes + volcanic scenery (plan logistics)
kidFriendly.longDesc: Volcanic scenery and lava tubes captivate curious minds, though families should plan logistics for comfortable exploration.

kidFriendly.name: Donuimun Museum Village
kidFriendly.desc: 4-18, Hands-on exhibits about; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 4-18 Hands-on exhibits about modern Korean life

kidFriendly.name: COEX Starfield Library
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18, Quick wow-factor stop;; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 0-18 Quick wow-factor stop; great on rainy days

kidFriendly.name: N Seoul Tower
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18, Cable car or; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 0-18 Cable car or short hike; kids love the “top of the city” feel

kidFriendly.name: Cheonggyecheon Stream Walk
kidFriendly.desc: 0-12, Flat; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 0-12 Flat, stroller-friendly; nice at dusk

kidFriendly.name: K-pop Pop-ups & Merch Run
kidFriendly.desc: 8-18, Plan around what’s; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 8-18 Plan around what’s trending; great for tweens/teens

kidFriendly.name: Bukhansan Easy Hike
kidFriendly.desc: 6-18, Choose a short; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 6-18 Choose a short trail; great views and nature in the city

kidFriendly.name: Gwangalli Beach Night Lights
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18, Bridge lights and; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 0-18 Bridge lights and wide beachfront walk

kidFriendly.name: Songdo Cable Car
kidFriendly.desc: 0-18, Short ride over; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 0-18 Short ride over the sea; glass-bottom cabins available

kidFriendly.name: Amnam Park Trails
kidFriendly.desc: 4-18, Forest trails +; great for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: 4-18 Forest trails + coastal viewpoints

kidFriendly.name: Spa Land (Centum City)
kidFriendly.desc: 13-18, Iconic jjimjilbang; best
kidFriendly.longDesc: 13-18 Iconic jjimjilbang; best for teens/adults

markets.name: Gwangjang Market
markets.desc: Traditional Market / Street Food; Bindaetteok, mayak gimbap, tteokbokki
markets.longDesc: Seoul's most vibrant traditional market, bursting with street food vendors serving iconic snacks like bindaetteok and mayak gimbap.

markets.name: Namdaemun Market
markets.desc: Traditional Market; Korean snacks, housewares, gifts
markets.longDesc: A sprawling traditional market packed with Korean snacks, souvenirs, housewares, and gifts—a one-stop shop for authentic takeaways.

markets.name: Myeongdong Street Food
markets.desc: Night Street Food; Hotteok, skewers, tteokbokki, desserts
markets.longDesc: Night street food vendors line this shopping district serving hotteok, skewers, tteokbokki, and desserts in an electrifying atmosphere.

markets.name: Mangwon Market
markets.longDesc: A neighborhood market with street snacks and local flavor, less touristy than downtown markets but no less delicious.

markets.name: Seongsu Café Corridor
markets.desc: Cafés + Concept Stores; Coffee, pastries (Cafe Onion, Daelim Warehouse)
markets.longDesc: A creative café and concept store corridor featuring specialty coffee and artisan pastries in an artsy neighborhood setting.

markets.name: Insadong Ssamziegil + Tea Streets
markets.desc: Crafts + Snacks; Traditional teas, sweets, crafts
markets.longDesc: A charming shopping complex and surrounding tea district offering traditional teas, sweets, and handcrafted souvenirs.

markets.name: Dongmun Traditional Market
markets.desc: Traditional Market; Seasonal fruit, seafood, hotteok (look for Yura-Imone)
markets.longDesc: Jeju's welcoming traditional market bursting with seasonal fruit, seafood, and specialties like hotteok.

markets.name: Seogwipo Maeil Olle Market
markets.desc: Traditional Market; Jeju tangerines, snacks, souvenirs
markets.longDesc: A authentic Jeju market selling tangerines, regional snacks, and thoughtful souvenirs in a local atmosphere.

markets.name: Dongdaemun Night Shopping
markets.desc: Wholesale Fashion / Night Market, Late-night fashion; quick
markets.longDesc: Wholesale Fashion / Night Market Late-night fashion; quick bites nearby

markets.name: Noryangjin Fish Market
markets.longDesc: Seafood Market Live seafood platters; grilled shellfish

markets.name: Euljiro Nogari Alley
markets.desc: Food Alley, Beer + Korean; food and culture
markets.longDesc: Food Alley Beer + Korean bar snacks

markets.name: Jagalchi Fish Market
markets.desc: Seafood Market, Sashimi; food and culture
markets.longDesc: Seafood Market Sashimi, grilled shellfish, sea urchin, crab

markets.name: Gukje Market
markets.longDesc: Market / Shopping Street snacks; vintage finds

markets.name: Bupyeong Kkangtong Market
markets.desc: Night Market, Hotteok; food and culture
